This week's Company Car Man is Ashwin Mistry OBE, chairman and chief executive of commercial insurance brokers BHIB which has its headquarters in Grove Park, Enderby 
Q – What car do you drive? 
A – Lexus LS600. It has all the toys I need and more 
Q – What should Theresa May do next? 
A – It’s too late to resign, so think things through very carefully, listen to real people and please provide leadership. Our country needs it 
Q – What do you make of people being caught out using offshore tax avoidance schemes – honest use of the rules or swindling the taxman and leaving the rest of us to pay? 
A – If it’s not illegal and rules aren’t broken, then it is what it is Even the Queen found herself included in the Paradise Papers - listing wealthy people with offshore investments (Image: Chris Gordon) 
Q – Leicester was recently announced as one of the best places to live in a PwC survey – what are its best points? What are its worst points? 
A – Best points are its location, its strong diversity and our three world class universities. Worst points are that we don’t shout anywhere near enough about all our good points 
Q – We have just had the Leicester Mercury Women in Business and our Business Executive Awards – what do you deserve an award for? 
A – Investing my life and soul in this city and county 
Q – Why does the UK Government seem to be dragging its heels over Brexit and can we achieve a decent solution? Prime Minister Theresa May outside Downing Street 
A – We do not have a coherent strategy and there is shameful political discord. A decent outcome would be a cross-party team managing a sensible transition period agreed sooner rather than later. Brexit does mean Brexit. 
Q – Japan’s PM fell into a golf bunker – what’s the most embarrassing thing that’s happened to you in public? 
A – I spoke out of turn at a dear friend’s son’s wedding reception, which I truly regret. Like us on Facebook
